title: Revisiting Once Human In 2025 (Endless Dream & RaidZone)
author: Force Gaming

key_facts: FACT: Once Human received a major update introducing the Endless Dream scenario, which overlays new dreamscapes across the entire game map.
FACT: The Endless Dream scenario features unique events that block access to key points of interest until cleared by players.
FACT: Players must defeat enemies and bosses in stages—easy, medium, and hard—to cleanse dream zones and restore access to content.
FACT: A new PvP-focused mode called Raid Zone has been added, resembling a free-to-play version of Rust with unrestricted base building and combat.
FACT: The game map has doubled in size since launch, with all original content preserved and expanded upon.
FACT: New resources like stardust source are now obtained from special trees within dream zones.
FACT: Nightmare tubes are used to summon bosses and can be activated by spending Santa Clarity, a new in-game resource.
FACT: Players can place structures during active dream zones, even without owning a base, enabling temporary fortifications.
FACT: The game now includes environmental hazards such as lightning strikes, tornadoes, floating TVs, and jelly-like entities.
FACT: The UI can be minimized into a clean immersion mode, with only contextual prompts appearing when near interactable objects.
FACT: The game retains core mechanics from launch, including crafting, survival systems, and POI clearing, but with increased difficulty.
FACT: The Raid Zone mode removes level progression and starts players with no gear, requiring them to gather resources from scratch.
FACT: Crafting recipes have been altered in Raid Zone, requiring different materials such as plant fibers instead of deer hide.
FACT: The game now features dynamic modifiers like weather effects and enemy healing mechanics that affect gameplay in dream zones.
FACT: Players can use time-reset abilities to extend their duration in high-risk nightmare zones.
key_opinions: OPINION: The new clean UI mode significantly enhances immersion and is preferred over cluttered on-screen displays.
OPINION: The increased difficulty in the overworld content is a welcome change after the game's initial ease at launch.
OPINION: The scenario selection process feels confusing and could benefit from major streamlining for new players.
OPINION: The addition of PvP in Raid Zone feels authentic to Rust’s style, making it a compelling evolution of the base game.
OPINION: The SCP-inspired lore and surreal elements add depth and uniqueness to the game’s atmosphere.
OPINION: The ability to build structures in dream zones adds strategic depth and creative freedom during boss fights.
OPINION: The game’s shift toward harder challenges shows a mature design philosophy focused on player engagement.
OPINION: The environmental chaos in dream zones, while overwhelming, makes each encounter feel unpredictable and intense.
OPINION: The new crafting system in Raid Zone feels more intentional and less repetitive than the base game’s approach.
OPINION: The game’s quirky terminology (e.g., calling seasons 'scenarios') adds charm and identity to its world-building.
OPINION: The lack of clear guidance in dream zone objectives leads to frustration despite the engaging mechanics.
OPINION: The game’s survival loop remains satisfying, but the new layer of dream events elevates it beyond mere repetition.
OPINION: The integration of real-time environmental threats (like lightning) increases tension and demands constant awareness.
OPINION: The game’s ability to evolve through seasonal content keeps it fresh and prevents stagnation.
OPINION: The Raid Zone mode feels like a bold experiment, successfully transforming Once Human into a full-fledged PvP survival title.
key_datapoints: DATA: The game map has doubled in size since launch, now encompassing twice the original area.
DATA: Players must clear three-tiered bosses—Light Dreamer, Deep Dreamer, and Eternal Dreamer—to progress through dream zones.
DATA: Nightmare tubes require Santa Clarity to activate, a new resource collected throughout the game.
DATA: Lightning strikes in dream zones can one-shot players depending on gear and positioning.
DATA: Players have 8 minutes of time limit in the Nightmare Zone before needing to reset via a time-renewal tool.
DATA: The Raid Zone mode starts players with no gear, requiring them to gather resources from scratch.
DATA: Plant fibers are now required for crafting basic gear in Raid Zone, replacing traditional materials like deer hide.
DATA: The game features multiple types of dream zone modifiers, including tornadoes, floating TVs, and environmental hazards.
DATA: Healing mechanisms allow enemies to regenerate health if they reach designated NPCs or TVs.
DATA: Players can place temporary structures during dream zones, even without owning a base.
DATA: The game includes a reality reset tool that extends time limits in nightmare zones by 15 minutes.
DATA: The game’s sanity loss mechanic is exacerbated in dream zones, requiring specific items to recover.
DATA: The new crossbow build is considered highly effective for headshots, especially when aiming down sights.
DATA: Players can now pass through collectibles without flying off their bike, improving movement fluidity.
DATA: The game retains all original dungeons, monoliths, silos, and POIs from launch, now integrated into the expanded map.
